intro: Alyxia loeseneriana var. macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited alyxia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant produces large, fleshy fruits that are often eaten by birds and other wildlife, aiding in seed dispersal. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in coastal areas or disturbed soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
